conclusion: Use principles of thermodynamics to find work done and heat absorbed.
Line segment AB is parallel to the V axis, indicating constant temperature and increasing volume.
The process from A to B is isothermal.
Work done by the gas from A to B is 10 J.
Initial state A has pressure p0 and volume V0.
Final state B has pressure p1 and volume 2V0.
For isothermal process, work done is W = nRT ln(2).
Given W = 10 J, so 10 = nRT ln 2.
Change in internal energy (ΔU) is zero for isothermal process.
According to First Law of Thermodynamics, ΔU = Q - W, so Q = W.
Heat absorbed by the gas Q is 10 J.
